instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Sometimes no Trackpad and Keyboard after sleep
threads.message:
Hello,

I have that board on which we've replaced the whole topcase (kb + tp) but same behavior.
It will sometimes works fine after sleep but sometimes you just get no TP+KB. External USB mouse and keyboard will work fine however.
I can see the caps lock light on when this is happening.

Any idea which area I should look at first?
Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Sometimes no Trackpad and Keyboard after sleep
threads.message: When it is not working is the TP+KB recognized as a USB device?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Sometimes no Trackpad and Keyboard after sleep
threads.message:
Hello Duke,

It seems yes as it still shows up in the system report...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Sometimes no Trackpad and Keyboard after sleep
threads.message: Probably on the TP interface. Inspect connector and traces for corrosion/damage, maybe bad <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>. This is probably going to suck :(
